intro: Parosela scariosa, commonly known as the scarious parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Parosela scariosa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun.
